intro: Physospermum verticillatum, commonly known as the whorled sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Physospermum verticillatum is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a member of the Scrophulariaceae family.
